name: Coxsone Dodd
description:
'''Clement Seymour''' "'''Coxsone'''" '''Dodd''' {{postnominals|list=[[Order of Distinction (Jamaica)|CD]]}} (26 January 1932 â€“ 4 May 2004) was a Jamaican record producer who was influential in the development of [[ska]] and [[reggae]] in the 1950s, 1960s and beyond.

He was nicknamed "Coxsone" at school due to his talent as a [[cricket]]er (his friends compared him to [[Alec Coxon]], a member of the 1940s [[Yorkshire County Cricket Club]] team).
